decision_conditions: work in accordance with British Standard
description: 1 x Caucasian Maple (T4552): Prune to clear lamp column by 1 m. 1 x False Acacia (T4514):  Prune to clear lamp column by 1 m.1 x London plane (T4631):  Reduce limbs to the east and southeast overhanging the children's playground, by around 2.5 m. Final cuts to be no greater than 100 mm diameter, leaving furnishing growth to minimise visual impact. 1 x London plane (T4530):  Reduce all extended lateral limbs by 2.5 - 3 m in the lower, mid and upper outer sections of the crown, tapering in to meet the current top centre of the crown, leaving a natural and balanced shape. All internal crown epicormic growth to be retained and final cuts are to be made at suitable pruning points, leaving furnishing growth. 1 x Red Horse Chestnut (T7481): Reduce the main terminal section of the subdominant stem/ limb to the west attached at 4 m by approximately 2.5 m. The secondary branches growing from the limb to be pruned by up to 1.5 m to balance the shape of the crown. Final cuts to be made at suitable pruning points, leaving furnishing growth. 1 x London plane (T4529): re-reduce stem to the southeast by around 2.5 m to the most recent, previous pruning points. Reduce the two leaning stems to the northeast overhanging the children's playground, by around 2.5 m. Final cuts to be no greater than 100 mm diameter, leaving furnishing growth.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
